intro: Brachystegia leonensis, commonly known as the Leonense brachystegia, is a deciduous tree native to the tropical rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Bombacaceae and is characterized by its thick, bark-like trunk and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. It plays an important role in the ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
